abstract: The trial of Jérôme Kerviel, accused of setting off nearly 5 billion euros in losses at the French bank Société Générale, ended Friday with judges and prosecutors conceding that a two-year investigation and three weeks of court hearings had left them no wiser about what had ultimately motivated the former trader to make his enormous, unauthorized bets.

lead_paragraph: The trial of Jérôme Kerviel, accused of setting off nearly 5 billion euros in losses at the French bank Société Générale, ended Friday with judges and prosecutors conceding that a two-year investigation and three weeks of court hearings had left them no wiser about what had ultimately motivated the former trader to make his enormous, unauthorized bets.

headline.main: Société Générale Trader Remains an Enigma
